text:
.@SecMayorkas made a huge blunder by granting waivers for environmental review to fast-track a border wall.

It contradicts President Biden's central promise not to continue the construction of the wall.

I’m calling on @DHSgov to reverse this decision by the end of the week.

.@POTUS should not be waiving 26 environmental laws and putting vulnerable communities in harm’s way to expedite the construction of a border wall. 

I hope his administration will reconsider this harmful decision.
Haha I wish I had as many followers as @unusual_whales! They do great work.
Investing in American-made steel and other critical manufacturing can bring family-sustaining jobs back to America and revitalize communities that have been left behind as production went overseas.

China makes almost 10x more steel than the next highest producing country, accounting for over half of all steel produced globally. China also emits twice as much CO2 per ton of steel as the US. We should be producing clean steel in America.
How? By helping companies develop and deploy modern steelmaking technologies and lead the world in producing lower embodied carbon steel.
Next, we need a CHIPS and Science Act for steel. We should invest in steel to narrow our trade deficit by reducing our dependence on imports and increasing our capacity for exports.

The investment in CHIPS has increased our productive capacity, strengthened our supply chains to reduce dependence on countries like China, and fortified our national security as semiconductors are an important component of defense tools and advanced technology.
CHIPS has also led to 50 community colleges in 19 states announcing investments in programs that prepare Americans for dignified jobs with family-sustaining wages in the semiconductor industry.

Since CHIPS became law, companies have announced $166 billion in investments in semiconductors & electronics. From Intel building facilities in Ohio to Micron building a plant in Clay, NY, these investments are boosting manufacturing & creating good-paying jobs across America.

According to @USTreasury, real manufacturing construction spending in the US has doubled since the end of 2021. 

The CHIPS and Science Act, which I co-led, has played the biggest role by far in this surge that is being driven by construction for semiconductor manufacturing.

Americans are worried about their gas and grocery bills.

Who cares about which member of Congress gets to keep their office?

This body lacks self-awareness of how out of touch we are with the American people.

The American people believe Congress is broken.

What is needed is not just a change of speaker, but also a bold reform plan to clean up the mess.

Ban PAC and lobbyist money, ban stock trading, enact term limits, and ban members of Congress from becoming lobbyists.
I stand with @RepJeffries and our caucus’s decision to vote yes to remove Speaker McCarthy from his chair. I hope we can quickly move past the dysfunction and focus on serving the American people.

Wall Street landlords are using taxpayer dollars to buy up single-family homes. It’s driving up costs for hardworking Americans. 

My bill, the Stop Wall Street Landlords Act, will end subsidies for corporate landlords and help make housing more affordable.

Public college, community college, and vocational training should be free for every American. 

Let’s pass @SenSanders’ College for All Act to ensure that education is a public good.
There are times when unity is called for. On the motion to vacate, I am committed to following @RepJeffries.

In the 2022 election cycle, 428 House members received $291.7 million from business PACs. 

It should be $0.
 
As one of the few to reject PAC money of any kind, I’m introducing a reform & anti-corruption plan that will ban members of Congress from receiving PAC & lobbyist money.

Happy birthday, President Carter! Your commitment to human rights, diplomacy, and getting PAC and corporate money out of politics has inspired me and many others. 

I’m so proud that interning at the @CarterCenter was one of my first jobs in politics.

I’m proud of @RepJeffries, @WhipKClark, @RepPeteAguilar & our entire caucus for being unified & disciplined in keeping the government open. 

It’s outrageous that members of Congress were going to get paid while our troops, federal employees & air traffic controllers weren’t.

As we prepare for a potential government shutdown, I wanted to share that my office will stay open, and my staff will be available to assist constituents. If you need help with a federal agency, please contact my Santa Clara office. 
khanna.house.gov/services/he…

I am sorry to hear about Senator Dianne Feinstein’s passing. She had an extraordinary career and was a true trailblazer. Her legacy will live on through her work as a key player in passing landmark bills on gun reform, LGBTQ+ rights, and combating deadly wildfires and droughts in California. This is very sad news and my thoughts are with her family and loved ones.

Today marks 23 years since mifepristone was approved by the FDA. Mifepristone is effective, safe & is used in more than half of all abortions in U.S. health centers & homes. 

Standing with the @ProChoiceCaucus in our fight to protect access to mifepristone & abortion.

It was an honor to receive the award for the best workplace environment in Congress from the @congressfdn. 

In Congress, we’ve got to model what we’re preaching. We should be paying family-supporting wages and treating our staff with dignity.
rollcall.com/2023/09/28/happ…

Republican witness Jonathan Turley called on McCarthy to hold a vote on an impeachment inquiry, which would fail badly. 

Turley also confirmed he would vote no today on impeachment itself.
.@CongBoyle coming with the facts.

A government shutdown would be disastrous. Our military won’t get paid along with millions of federal employees.

Airport delays could be even worse, and it will slow down government services. We must do everything we can to stop it.

The U.S. is giving nearly half a trillion dollars to price-gouging defense contractors and over $20 billion in subsidies to Big Oil companies.

Republicans would rather cut programs for working families than rein in corporate handouts.

We have one of the safest districts in America. Sunnyvale was ranked the 9th safest in the country along with Fremont ranked 19th and San Jose 24th safest in America. 

I would be happy to give you a tour @cvpayne if you visit. @TeamCavuto
kron4.com/news/bay-area/this…
My political reform plan will ban PAC and lobbyist donations, create term limits for members of Congress, and ban stock trading. @cvpayne agreed that it's a commonsense bipartisan proposal.

Republicans are the ones attacking the NLRB, blocking the PRO Act, and keeping the minimum wage low. 

They’ll support workers when it’s politically convenient, but not when it really matters.

So much of the power in this country is in the hands of the ultra-wealthy or big corporations. 

My anti-corruption and political reform plan will ban PAC and lobbyist donations and stop members of Congress from trading stocks. It’s time to get big money out of politics.

It’s outrageous that American tax dollars are helping Wall Street buy up single-family homes. 

My bill, the Stop Wall Street Landlords Act, will put an end to subsidies for corporate landlords and help make housing more affordable.

It was an honor to receive the award for best workplace environment in Congress from the @congressfdn. I’m proud of my team and of all the young people on Capitol Hill who want to pursue public service.

The top 1% are responsible for over $160 billion in lost revenue each year because of tax avoidance. 

If Republicans want to tackle the debt, they should start with funding the IRS to make sure corporations and the ultra-wealthy pay the taxes they owe.
Wishing everyone observing Yom Kippur in my district and around the world an easy and meaningful fast. G’mar Chatima Tovah.

Medical debt shouldn’t exist in one of the richest countries on earth. 

Let’s cancel it and pass Medicare for All.

The Big Three auto companies are making $21 billion in profits. They are taking that money and putting $5 billion in buying their own stock to enrich their shareholders. 

They can afford to give their workers fair wages and good benefits.
Thanks to @RepMaxwellFrost along with the activists and survivors who have fueled the movement to end gun violence and made this victory possible.

We need term limits and a code of ethics for Supreme Court Justices.
 
My anti-corruption and reform plan will end lifetime appointments for justices.
.@ShawnFainUAW is an American hero. He’s not just speaking out for @UAW, he’s speaking out for what the working class has wanted for the last four decades.

A strong step by @CFPB to remove medical debt from Americans’ credit reports.

I’m working on a bill to cancel medical debt.
We can have both economic and climate justice –– and that starts by ensuring that the electric vehicle industry is entirely unionized and that EV jobs come with union standards.
CEO pay has skyrocketed over the past four decades while corporations have raked in historic profits. They can afford to pay their workers fair wages.
Completely agree. Members shouldn’t get paid while hardworking families suffer.

Ban PAC and lobbyist donations.

Complete ban on stock trading and ban on members of Congress from becoming lobbyists.

12-year term limits for Congress and 18-year term limits for SCOTUS.

This is how we get big money out of Washington and rebuild public trust.

I asked Lockheed’s CEO about the 60 Minutes report that found they made over 40% profits for PAC-3 and whether he’d commit to not having profits over 20% for any system. 

He was unwilling to commit to even that number. I asked for a list of all the weapons systems where they make over 15%. I look forward to seeing the list.

A Civilian Climate Corps will create thousands of good-paying union jobs & help us build a clean economy. 

Thanks @POTUS for listening to the young activists who pushed for this along with @SenMarkey, @RepAOC, my colleagues & I as we’ve called for executive action.

Democrats have an agenda to help working class Americans with the cost of housing, food, and childcare.

For all of Republicans’ rhetoric about costs, they’re not doing anything about it. They want to shut down the government and it’s the height of irresponsibility. @JoyAnnReid

After hearing @ParisHilton’s story and the stories of so many survivors of the “troubled teen” industry, it has become clear that Congress needs to act with urgency to stop institutional child abuse. 

My bill with @RepBuddyCarter will help ensure transparency and accountability.

When I led a delegation to India to celebrate Independence Day, I knew that Bollywood had to be a focus of the trip because of its role in telling India’s story after colonialism. 

Read my @THR op-ed about meeting with @SrBachchan & Bollywood stars.
hollywoodreporter.com/news/p…
Thanks to @FightFossils & @Fridays4future for organizing it and bringing attention to the climate emergency.

.@POTUS needs to declare a climate emergency and keep his promise of no new drilling on public lands.
 
Thanks to @genzforchange, @jamieclimate, @climatedefiance, @sunrisemvmt and the thousands of activists who marched in NY calling for urgent action. We see you and hear you.
Thank you for your leadership in standing against corruption and for promoting transparency in Washington.
Wishing all those celebrating Rosh Hashanah a happy and sweet New Year. I hope you enjoy this time gathering with family and loved ones.
Speaker McCarthy, call a vote. Let’s have a roll call on all 5 provisions and see exactly where each Member stands.

Over the last four years, the CEOs of the Big Three received on average a 40% pay raise on top of their multimillion-dollar salaries while autoworkers saw their pay increase 6%. 

@UAW workers deserve fair wages & to be treated with dignity. Solidarity with the workers on strike.
These documents prove that Exxon continued to spread disinformation about the climate crisis to generate profit under Rex Tillerson. Big Oil must be held accountable.

We need a 5-point plan to address corruption and big money in Congress, including term limits, judicial ethics, and banning stock trading along with PAC and lobbyist money. @unusual_whales @QuiverQuant @CREWcrew

China’s dominance in steel threatens our economy, national security & the climate. 

I am committed to introducing a modern steel bill to revitalize steel production in the U.S., reduce emissions, & restore our nation's leadership in this critical sector. foxnews.com/opinion/bring-ba…

The CEOs of the Big Three are making close to 360x more than the average worker while receiving billions in taxpayer dollars. All that @UAW is asking for –– as Shawn Fain and I wrote in an op-ed –– is for their workers to be paid a reasonable family supporting wage.

And I’d do it again! We need to rein in Big Pharma’s greed.
mediaite.com/politics/house-…

.@JNJNews has made over $22 billion from Imbruvica, a drug to treat leukemia. Now, they are suing the government to stop Medicare from lowering drug prices. I questioned a Big Pharma lawyer about the flimsy legal theory they are floating in a desperate attempt to protect profits.

The financialization of housing since 2008 is responsible in part for the soaring rents and the high cost of living in our state and many parts of the country. 

I have a bill, the Stop Wall Street Landlords Act, that will help make homeownership affordable again.
Thanks to @AnaKasparian and @cenkuygur for highlighting my new 5-step political reform and anti-corruption plan that will help tackle the crisis of confidence in our institutions.
Medicare for All will save $450 billion per year. It’s good economic policy and the right thing to do.

On the 22nd anniversary of the 9/11 attacks, we come together to remember the victims of this tragedy & keep their families & loved ones in our thoughts. 

We also honor the courageous first responders who risked their lives to serve our country. #NeverForget

Republicans know what’s at stake for Americans if they continue holding our budget hostage: funding for childcare, Social Security, rental assistance, and SNAP.

Still, they are so beholden to the extreme wings that they are reneging on the deal Kevin McCarthy made with @POTUS.

Only 37% of Americans have confidence in the Supreme Court while 68% support term limits for Justices. By passing my term limits bill, we can restore public trust in the Court. 

18 years is long enough.
This is devastating. My condolences are with the families and loved ones of those killed. Keeping everyone impacted by this tragedy in my thoughts.

I have a plan to reshape how Washington works starting with a ban on all PAC and lobbyist money. I’ve never taken a dime of that money because you can’t fix a broken campaign finance system if you are reliant on big special interests.
Why can we spend nearly a trillion on defense, but can’t reauthorize $24 billion in child care funding?
99.7% of all products, including prescription drugs, approved by the FDA from 2010 to 2019 had public NIH funding. Americans are being priced out of prescription drugs they've already invested in.
Congress should restore tax deductions for union dues.

At a recent hearing, @RepAuchincloss, @RepAndyKimNJ, and I asked our committee’s witnesses about the importance of this funding for our country’s innovation, national security, and economy. 

Here was their response:

Republicans are trying to hold our budget hostage and cut science funding that helps us compete with the CCP's policies. 

I joined @CmteOnCCPDems in calling on the House Appropriations Committee to fund investments in science at levels authorized by the CHIPS and Science Act.

Reminder: I’m hosting my monthly town hall in Newark tomorrow at 7pm PT. I look forward to taking your questions and sharing updates on my latest work in Congress. RSVP here: khannaforms.house.gov/forms/…

Allowing this funding to run out will be a disaster for our economy and will cost working parents millions of dollars. 

As co-chair of the Bipartisan Affordable Childcare Caucus, I’m working to pass emergency childcare funding and I’m urging Republicans to join us.

100 million Americans are struggling with medical debt while CEOs are raking in huge profits. 

Cancel medical debt and pass Medicare for All.

Republicans are trying to cut funding that helps us fight wildfires. This puts our communities in danger. 

It’s time to declare a climate emergency, hold Big Oil accountable, and take action to reduce emissions.

An important piece from @GrimKim. As we invest in making America a leader in manufacturing again, we must put worker safety over profits and protect the right to organize. 
teenvogue.com/story/workplac…

One in five student loan borrowers say they’ll struggle to repay loans when payments resume next month. 

@POTUS should use his authority under the Higher Education Act to stop interest accrual and make good on his promise to forgive student debt.

This Labor Day, I stand with the workers across every industry who are making historic progress & standing up for better wages, conditions & benefits. 

In Congress, we must continue fighting to raise the minimum wage, pass the PRO Act & protect the right to organize.
Join me on Friday, September 8th at 7pm PT in Newark for my town hall where I’ll discuss my latest work in Congress and take your questions. RSVP: khannaforms.house.gov/forms/…

Families are spending on average 27% of their household income on childcare. It’s hurting working parents and our economy. 

Congress must provide funding in the short term before the September 30th funding cliff. In the long term, I’m working to provide childcare at $10 per day.

The Green New Deal is more than just an environmental policy –– it's a blueprint for an equitable and sustainable future. 

It's an investment in clean energy infrastructure, high-quality jobs, and ensuring that communities hurt most by climate change are prioritized.
The Reward Work Act, my bill with @RepChuyGarcia & @RepValHoyle, would rein in stock buybacks and empower workers. Let's pass it.

Parents are projected to lose $9 billion per year in earnings if Congress doesn’t act before the September 30th childcare funding cliff according to @TCFdotorg. 

Republicans must join us in providing funding for childcare.

From California to South Carolina and across the globe, we are all bearing witness to the catastrophic impacts of the climate crisis. 

It’s time for Congress to take decisive climate action that puts justice first. Read my op-ed with @KingdomLiving4u.
thehill.com/opinion/congress…
The Big Three (GM, Ford, and Stellantis) raked in $21 billion in profits in just the first half of this year. Their workers deserve a fair contract and good wages.

Healthcare costs are nearly 20% of our GDP. It’s hurting working people’s wages and it’s making it harder to bring manufacturing here. 

It’s pro economic growth to reduce costs and to give everyone healthcare. We need Medicare for All.

We need to invest in affordable care and good-paying jobs. It’s unacceptable that the median wage for childcare workers is $13.22/hr. I’m working on a bill that will provide quality childcare for $10 per day while guaranteeing an investment in good wages for workers.

This is also about the well-being of children in this country. According to @BrookingsInst, high-quality early childcare can reduce the “achievement gap” by half. It has a huge impact on outcomes for children.

In the long term, we must make childcare affordable for everyone. Last year, 85% of women who left the workforce said that childcare issues were a top reason. Businesses are losing billions of dollars and our economy is suffering.

As co-chair of the Bipartisan Affordable Childcare Caucus, I’m urging Republicans to join us in extending the funding from the American Rescue Plan that was keeping childcare providers afloat. Even @FoxNews recognizes the urgency of this situation ⬇️

Childcare costs have skyrocketed 220% since 1990, outpacing inflation. The average cost for families is now $10,000 per year. 

On top of that, Congress has a September 30th childcare funding cliff. If we don’t act, 70,000 childcare centers could close.

Pharmaceutical companies are making billions of dollars in profits & it’s going to their shareholders & stock buybacks more than R&D. Americans are getting fleeced & @POTUS is lowering costs & reducing our deficit by allowing Medicare to negotiate the cost of prescription drugs.

It’s outrageous that American tax dollars are helping Wall Street buy up single-family homes.

My bill, the Stop Wall Street Landlords Act, will end these incentives for corporate landlords and help make homeownership affordable for everyone.
.@foxandfriends agrees. Affordable childcare is a bipartisan issue. Families are paying over $10,000 per year on average. We should fund childcare and avoid the cliff.

My heart breaks for the UNC Chapel Hill community and my condolences are with the family of the faculty member who was killed. 

No one should have to experience this on a college campus or anywhere in America. Congress must step up and pass comprehensive gun reform.

If Congress doesn’t act before the Sept. 30th childcare funding cliff, 70,000 childcare centers could close. 

As co-chair of the Bipartisan Affordable Childcare Caucus, I’m working to extend that funding & provide quality childcare for families at $10 per day in the long term.

As we mark the 60th anniversary of the March on Washington, let us reflect on Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. & the leaders of the civil rights movement’s vision for equality, opportunity & livable wages. 

We must continue our work to combat poverty, racism & injustice.
If the U.S. is serious about tackling climate change, then why are we giving Big Oil companies billions in subsidies each year during a climate emergency?

The average cost of childcare is $10,000. Women are being forced to leave the workforce because of the cost and it’s causing businesses to lose billions of dollars.

Investing in affordable childcare is good for families and is pro economic growth. @FaceTheNation
I'm heartbroken to see this news. My condolences are with the families and loved ones of the three Marines who were killed. Praying for those injured to make a quick and full recovery.

On this Women’s Equality Day, the rights of women — including the right to vote & abortion access — are under attack by extremists. 

As we honor the progress made towards gender equality throughout history, we must continue our work to protect women's rights.

I'm joining @FacetheNation along with @RepNancyMace this Sunday to talk about our new Bipartisan Affordable Childcare Caucus and providing government support so every American family has affordable childcare. Tune in!

When the Fed raises interest rates, it makes it more expensive to buy a house, a car, and to have credit card debt. 

We should be raising taxes on the ultra-wealthy to tackle inflation.

Overturning Roe v. Wade defied not only 50 years of legal precedent, but also the will of the American people. 

On Reproductive Freedom Day of Action, I stand with the @ProChoiceCaucus as we continue to fight back and protect the fundamental right to an abortion.

61% of adults are living paycheck to paycheck. Resuming student loan payments during an affordability crisis hurts hardworking people & our economy.

@POTUS should use his authority under the Higher Education Act to stop interest accrual & make good on the promise to cancel debt.
Join me for my town hall in San Jose on Sunday, August 27th at 6pm PT. I’ll discuss my latest work in Congress and take your questions. RSVP here: khannaforms.house.gov/forms/…

The U.S. health care sector is responsible for 8.5% of our country’s emissions. We need to tackle pollution from our hospitals while making them resilient to climate change. 

That’s why I introduced the Green New Deal for Health with @SenMarkey.

This is heartbreaking. My condolences are with the families and loved ones of those killed in this tragic shooting. 

Every American deserves to live without fear of gun violence in their communities.

Supreme Court Justices shouldn’t be accepting lavish gifts and travel. Period. 

We need to pass a code of ethics and my bill to create term limits for justices.
Pharmaceutical companies are raking in huge profits while making it harder for patients to get the life-saving medications they need. That is just wrong.
This is a climate emergency. Let’s stop handing out billions to Big Oil companies that are fueling this crisis and instead invest in climate solutions.

Medicare Advantage is private insurance that often denies coverage when it’s most needed. 

My bill, the Save Medicare Act, with @RepMarkPocan and @janschakowsky, will stop companies from using this deceptive labeling and will help seniors get the care they need.

The Mountain Valley Pipeline Southgate extension is a threat to our environment & the health of the surrounding communities in Virginia & North Carolina. 

I joined @RepKManning, @RepMcClellan, @ValerieFoushee & @BobbyScott in calling on @FERC to oppose it moving forward.

We’ve watched places like my district prosper, while other places were left behind. 

We should bring steel plants to communities that have lost them. They would be far cleaner than in China & allow America to lead in the new age of industrialization.
newsweek.com/factories-key-d…

Over 100 million Americans currently have medical debt. Our healthcare system isn’t working for everyday people. 

Let’s cancel medical debt and pass Medicare for All.

According to @EconomicPolicy, the trade deficit with China cost the U.S. 3.7 trillion jobs between 2001 and 2018.

We need a new economic patriotism to revitalize American manufacturing and bring jobs back.
Big Oil is making empty climate pledges. Congress must step up and pass my windfall tax on fossil fuel companies to rein in their greed.

9 out of the top 15 steel companies are Chinese. We don’t have a single one. 

Any new steel acquisitions in the US must be led by American companies that support union workers.
It’s abysmal that the federal minimum wage is still just $7.25/hour. We should raise it to $17/hour.

Wall Street is increasingly buying up single family homes and pushing homeownership out of reach for Americans.
 
My Stop Wall Street Landlords Act will stop the financialization of housing.
I'm calling on @StateDept to add Abdulhadi al-Khawaja to their #WithoutJustCause political prisoner campaign. He is undergoing a hunger strike in Bahrain where his health is in serious condition.
Sorry to hear this, Evan. I’m thinking of your brother and his partner and grateful for their service.
On the 103rd anniversary of the 19th amendment, we celebrate all the women who fought for the right to vote. We must continue to fight for equal access to the ballot box as a fundamental right.
The way we deliver relief is by capping interest rates, providing more affordable housing, canceling student debt for the working and middle class, and canceling medical debt.
Making kids go hungry is cruel and hurts their ability to learn. School lunch should be free and universal.

Thank you for hosting our delegation,  discussing how to strengthen the U.S. India relationship and even indulging my Hindi. We appreciated the warmth and hospitality with which India welcomed our delegation. Chai, sandwiches, and samosas at every meeting.

How long will we allow the Supreme Court to just continually be an obstacle to popular, majoritarian policy that helps the working class? We need to reform the Court starting with 18 year term limits for Supreme Court Justices.

1.03 trillion in credit card debt.

12.04 trillion in mortgage debt.

1.75 trillion in student debt.

$195 billion in medical debt.

Americans are drowning in debt, we need to deliver relief.

We are spending billions on defense contractors while cutting relief for the poor, ignoring the climate crisis, and abandoning students with loans. Yet almost no one is willing to question the status quo. This is why people feel like Congress is broken.

The Inflation Reduction Act is the biggest investment in climate that any country has ever made. It expanded health care and capped the price of insulin at $35 per month for those on Medicare. We should think of it as a down payment and keep pushing for more.

CEO pay at the Big Three auto companies is up 40% in four years; autoworker wages are up 6% in that time.

This is unacceptable corporate greed. @UAW workers deserve a piece of the profits.

It’s been 193 days since the train derailment in East Palestine and Congress has not done anything to help residents or prevent future disasters. I introduced a bill months ago to strengthen safety regulations currently languishing in the House. It’s unacceptable.
I’m on @SenSanders' bill to wipe out school lunch debt and make all school meals free. Let’s pass it.

Gen Z can’t afford the rent because prices have increased by over 42% in the last 10 years. They are right to be angry! 

We need to take on corporate greed and build more affordable housing.
I was honored to visit Raj Ghat on India’s Independence Day to pay my respects to Mahatma Gandhi, one of the world’s greatest leaders. I also had the chance to lead our delegation at the Red Fort.

After 38 vacations, 26 private jet flights, 12 VIP sporting passes, 8 helicopter flights, and 2 luxury resorts paid for by billionaires, this feels like a good time for Congress to pass a Supreme Court code of ethics.
For 88 years, Social Security has allowed Americans to retire with dignity. Now, let’s scrap the income cap to extend solvency and expand benefits.
This is big. Young people are driving change in Montana and across the country!

100 million Americans hold nearly $200 billion in medical debt. Corporate greed has made healthcare unaffordable and inaccessible.

Let’s cancel medical debt and pass Medicare for All.

Big Oil got $196 billion in profits last year and we got a summer of wildfires, smoke, floods, and extreme heat. 

We must hold the fossil fuel industry accountable & pass a windfall profits tax.
The Big Three auto companies have made a quarter of a trillion – $250,000,000,000 – in North American profits since 2013. @UAW workers deserve a piece of those profits.

Last year, the national median household income was $71,721 & average monthly rent was $1,794. Break that down: the typical renter spent over 30% of their income on rent. I have a bill to make housing affordable again, it’s time for Congress to pass it.
Had several times in my twenties when I was a few days late on rent waiting to get paid. Got charged $100 for it each time. This is a great bill and I will cosponsor.
This isn’t getting the attention it deserves. 30,000 union jobs lost. Workers who had been there over for decades given no notice. And it’s a private equity firm that gets relief??
My condolences to the families and loved ones of those killed in the Maui wildfires. This is another tragic example of why we must urgently address the climate crisis.
Exactly why I introduced a bill to end lifetime appointments. Let’s pass it along with a code of ethics for justices.

Declaring a climate emergency would help save lives & our environment by allowing @POTUS to:

✅reinstitute a ban on crude oil exports & halt offshore drilling
✅expand the DPA for more renewable manufacturing
✅direct billions in disaster relief to climate resiliency

Abortion rights are supported by a majority of Americans. 

As we saw in Ohio, extreme conservatives who are out of touch with everyday people can't change the rules and ignore the will of the public. It won’t work.

It’s an honor to be leading a delegation to India today as Co-Chair of the India Caucus to celebrate Independence Day and reflect on the sacrifices made by my grandfather, Amarnath Vidyalankar, a freedom fighter who spent several years in jail with Gandhi.
usatoday.com/story/news/poli…

This is just the start. In one year, the CHIPS and Science Act has brought good-paying jobs to communities like Clay, New York and New Albany, Ohio. 

It’s also supporting cutting edge innovation and research in my district and helping America be a leader in technology.

Companies like Applied Materials in my district have committed to invest up to $4 billion to build the largest semiconductor research facility in the industry. 

I joined CEO Gary Dickerson last week for a tour of their facilities and to see their incredible work.

Intel, which is based in my district, announced it would invest up to $100 billion in semiconductor plants in Ohio following the CHIPS and Science Act last year. 

I was proud to join @POTUS and @PGelsinger at the groundbreaking for a new facility.

Investments in U.S. production, jobs & education:

✅$231 billion in private sector investments for semiconductor manufacturing.

✅ 45+ community colleges added new or expanded semiconductor jobs programs.

✅@NSF created partnerships to expand the semiconductor workforce.

One year ago, I joined @POTUS for the signing of the CHIPS and Science Act, which I co-authored with @SenSchumer, @SenToddYoung & @RepGallagher. 

CHIPS provides $52 billion for the semiconductor industry in the U.S. & is set to create 100,000 jobs. Here are the results so far ⬇️
Glad to see this acknowledgement of overreach by a lower court blocking the government from regulating ghost guns. This policy will save lives.

Americans are already suffering from extreme weather because of Big Oil’s pollution and greed. 

They shouldn’t have to pay a cent to clean up oil and gas wells on public lands.

Their water and rivers still have visible chemicals steaming up. I was glad to hear that @SenVancePress & @SenSherrodBrown have been responsive. We need the Biden admin to declare a federal emergency to help clean up the dangerous chemicals and rebuild these communities.

I met with residents of East Palestine who live near the spot of the train derailment. We met given my work on legislation to prevent derailments. 

They told me about how their lips burn, rashes appear, kids have nose bleeds, about seizures & how difficult it is to breathe.

Principle 3: A progress payment incentive program. This would require the Defense Department to implement a program that would have made accelerated payments to defense contractors contingent upon responsiveness to various metrics like cost and schedule performance.
@RepDeluzio’s Amendment 311 in the NDAA lowers the mandatory disclosure threshold for contractors to provide certified cost and pricing information from $2,000,000 to $750,000.

As a result, the Pentagon frequently needs help assessing whether the prices agreed upon are competitive in the market, as it does not receive certified data from companies with contracts valued below $2 million.

Principle 2: Mandatory Disclosure Threshold. Over the years, Congress has gradually increased the mandatory disclosure threshold, which determines the amount the government must spend before companies are required to provide certified cost and pricing information to the Pentagon.

Principle 1: Mandatory Refunds. 
The Pentagon has limited options to request reimbursements from companies that engage in price-gouging. We need regulation to force mandatory refunds from companies that are engaging in waste and fraud.
